reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update 10/10/15 -  The game is really coming along and doing so a decent pace.  I actually think one of the coolest things for me is watching the entire game develop.  You don't log on for a few weeks and now you have a new class to try.  New enemies pop up.


I've definitely enjoyed this game already, despite some of the bugs.  Even in alpha, this game has a lot of positives to it.  You can see where they're going with the job system, and they make your units mattering, which is very different then some similar games I've played.

To give an example, you can't switch a unit to a shepard until it has reached lv. 3 as a trapper for the unit.  That makes things like goblin attacks actually matter, because your lone trapper in the woods will die.  It's little ideas and notions like this that make the game good.

As some people have mentioned, the content isn't all the way there, with a large amount of the jobs missing, and several bugs that can be annoying. (units not finishing a house, i.e. laying the groundwork but not actually completing it.)

Overall though I really enjoy the game so far and I would definitely recommend picking it up.  It's definitely shaping up to be a successful title.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After slowly getting into this game and learning the jist of things I'm beginning to find it really entertaining and taking up a lot of my time.

You start with the basics and a small ammount of villagers which is more than enough to get your first village started. The building construction does get a bit bugged out at times but hey it's early access. You do have to create each individual item for said buildings like window frames and door. Which is awesome. You get raiding parties which aren't all hard but they feel like they get progressively harder as the game goes on.

I didn't quite understand the custom building tools til after a bit of experimenting but it's really easy, even the average joe can do it. Would highly reccommend this game if you enjoy village construction.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Minecraft + City Builder = Stonehearth

I took a chance on this early access game. As others have commented, it does have it's bugs. Since the game is still in Alpha, this is to be expected. All I can say is, save often.

So far the game has been charming and fun. I enjoy city building games, but have never seen one this small and quaint. It takes the creativity of a game like Minecraft and gives it direction. It isn't the most challenging game and focuses more on imagination and less on hair-pulling micro managing. I am glad I got it and I can't wait to see what other features they add.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nRight now the devs are making good process and laying down new ideas that will make any timber and stone or city builder game fan/player poop thier pants for. The glitches while still existing are being fixed and in the last update they fixed a few of which I cant name, and making progress to fixing the idle NPC glitch. Right now you can build a village or castle and defend it from foes. The graphics are very nice to look at. The gameplay is compareable to Timber and Stone yet diffrent in a few ways. The combat is a bit buggy right now and there are no archers as of yet. And Stonehearth just feels a bit more laid back. If you want a more rouge like, difficult complex game I recomend Timber and Stone. It was just released on steam. But if you want a peaceful. toned down and ever so slightly simpler game this is the route to go. I feel as this could be an amazing game but said glitches hold it back. Right now its a 7/10 but once completed this could be an easy 8-9/10. If you have the cash and the patience to handle bugs pick it up. Thogh if you dont want to pay 25 bucks for early alpha thats fine. (A pet peve of mine is when games cost over 20 or 50 bucks so I have to buy two steam cards. I will make an exption for this)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Does the game have problems? Totally, but it's Early Access so I'm recommending this on the hope the flaws get worked out.

Only problems I REALLY want fixed that are kinda game-breaking all are in the AI of the Hearthlings. Mine might randomly stop working (they all go idle at once and stay that way) or will refuse to put anything in the designated storage areas unless I practically hold a gun to their heads (the AI can't prioritize things presently so it kinda becomes a cluster♥♥♥♥ if more than two instructions are given to them at once).

Also how the Hearthlings build needs tweaking desperately. If you say forget to put a roof on a building, you'd think you could just plop one on and that's the end. Unfortunately, my citizens don't seem to get the concept of finishing the wall segemnts on the raised roof, leaving a horrible looking mess of ladders and scaffolding. As other people have mentioned in the forums, these little guys REALLY don't get the concept of walls inside a building either (they refuse to put a roof on a building with free-standing walls inside it, so goodbye privacy in the lodge.

Despite these major flaws, the game is awesome. It's like Banished but more cartoony and owns the childish tone amazingly. If anything, it's just like when Banished first got on Steam, and after getting major bugs worked out, it's one of my favorite games to play if I want to micromanage.

Overall, BUY THIS BECAUSE MAULS ARE FOR FLATTENING FACES." Best description ever for a stone hammer."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A good game, a few bugs here and there but my game as never crashed.

The Pluses: A game that allows you to make your own buildings (Thats why I wanted this game)
It has a easy-to-learn system
If you don't wanna buld, pre-made structures
Nice music, fits the game
When you start, your not placed in a random area (Like Minecraft, unless you choose quick start or something), but your able to choose where you want to go. It says how many trees, animals and minerals are in that area.
Your able to collect over 1000 wood in a few minutes :3

The things that might be ideas or minuses
I hope that they might add a creative mode, because I really don't want to dig for things (Digging is time consuming)
People randomly get stuck in my giant pile of items
There should be a tutorial, so if people don't know how to play, they can learn how to do the basic things
Maybe when you play survival, there is an enemy meter. The higher it is the more spawns you find. If its 4, it means that you fight 10 goblins a day, but if its 0, there aren't any spawns near you, but there will be massive hordes.

The Verdict is that it is one of the best early access games I have ever seen.
